title: The Biden-Trump Presidential Debate
content:
--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 1 (1228-1533) ---
er President Trump will be on the left side of the screen. President Biden will be appearing on the right. A coin toss determined their positions.

Each candidate will have two minutes to answer a question, and one minute each for responses and rebuttals. An additional minute for follow-up, clarification

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 2 (2326-2628) ---
PPER:  And please welcome the 45th president of the United States, Donald Trump.

Gentlemen, thanks so much for being here. Letï¿½s begin the debate. And letï¿½s start with the issue that voters consistently say is their top concern, the economy.

President Biden, inflation has slowed, but prices rema

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 3 (2881-3564) ---
e worse off under your presidency than they were under President Trump?

BIDEN:  You have to take a look at what I was left when I became president, what Mr. Trump left me.

We had an economy that was in freefall. The pandemic are so badly handled, many people were dying. All he said was, itï¿½s not that serious. Just inject a little bleach in your arm. Itï¿½d be all right.

The economy collapsed. There were no jobs. Unemployment rate rose to 15 percent. It was terrible.

And so, what we had to do is try to put things back together again. Thatï¿½s exactly what we began to do. We created 15,000 new jobs. We brought on ï¿½ in a position where we have 800,000 new manufacturing

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 4 (3849-4767) ---
ice of gas, the price of housing, the price of a whole range of things.

Thatï¿½s why Iï¿½m working so hard to make sure I deal with those problems. And weï¿½re going to make sure that we reduce the price of housing. Weï¿½re going to make sure we build 2 million new units. Weï¿½re going to make sure we cap rents, so corporate greed canï¿½t take over.

The combination of what I was left and then corporate greed are the reason why weï¿½re in this problem right now.

In addition to that, weï¿½re in a situation where if you had ï¿½ take a look at all that was done in his administration, he didnï¿½t do much at all. By the time he left, thereï¿½s ï¿½ things had been in chaos. There was (ph) literally chaos.

And so, we put things back together. We created, as I said, those (ph) jobs. We made sure we had a situation where we now ï¿½ we brought down the price of prescription drugs, which is a major issue for many

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 5 (4943-5942) ---
he situation is making ï¿½ and weï¿½re going to make that available to everybody, to all Americans. So weï¿½re working to bring down the prices around the kitchen table. And thatï¿½s what weï¿½re going to get done.

TAPPER:  Thank you.

President Trump?

DONALD TRUMP, FORMER PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES AND CURRENT U.S. PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE: We had the greatest economy in the history of our country. We had never done so well. Every ï¿½ everybody was amazed by it. Other countries were copying us.

We got hit with COVID. And when we did, we spent the money necessary so we wouldnï¿½t end up in a Great Depression the likes of which we had in 1929. By the time we finished ï¿½ so we did a great job. We got a lot of credit for the economy, a lot of credit for the military, and no wars and so many other things. Everything was rocking good.

But the thing we never got the credit for, and we should have, is getting us out of that COVID mess. He created mandates; that was a disaster for our

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 6 (6306-6811) ---
s killing our country. It is absolutely killing us.

TAPPER:  Thank you.

President Biden?

BIDEN:  Well, look, the greatest economy in the world, heï¿½s the only one who thinks that, I think. I donï¿½t know anybody else who thinks it was great ï¿½ he had the greatest economy in the world.

And, you know, the fact of the matter is that we found ourselves in a situation where his economy ï¿½ he rewarded the wealthy. He had the largest tax cut in American history, $2 trillion. He raised the deficit lar

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 7 (6954-7262) ---
n, since Herbert Hoover. The idea that he did something that was significant.

And the military ï¿½ you know, when he was president, they were still killing people in Afghanistan. He didnï¿½t do anything about that. When he was president, we still found ourselves in a position where you had a notion that we

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 8 (7347-7787) ---
snï¿½t have any ï¿½ this ï¿½ this decade ï¿½ doesnï¿½t have any troops dying anywhere in the world, like he did.

TAPPER:  President Trump, I want to follow up, if I can. You wantedï¿½

TRUMP:  Am I allowed to respond to him?

TAPPER:  Well, Iï¿½m going to ask you a follow-up. You can do whatever you want with the minute that we give you.

I want to follow up. You want to impose a 10 percent tariff on all goods coming into the U.S. How

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 9 (7868-8421) ---
to drive them higher. Itï¿½s just going to cause countries that have been ripping us off for years, like China and many others, in all fairness to China ï¿½ itï¿½s going to just force them to pay us a lot of money, reduce our deficit tremendously, and give us a lot of power for other things.

But he ï¿½ he made a statement. The only thing he was right about is I gave you the largest tax cut in history. I also gave you the largest regulation cut in history. Thatï¿½s why we had all the jobs. And the jobs went down and then they bounced back and heï¿

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 10 (8570-8874) ---
t stayed that way for 14 months. And then it blew up under his leadership, because they spent money like a bunch of people that didnï¿½t know what they were doing. And they donï¿½t know what they were doing. It was the worst ï¿½ probably the worst administration in history. Thereï¿½s never been.

And as

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 11 (9249-9622) ---
n-partisan analysis, President Trump, your administration approved $8.4 trillion in new debt. While so far, President Biden, youï¿½ve approved $4.3 trillion in new debt.

So former President Trump, many of the tax cuts that you signed into law are set to expire next year. You want to extend them and go even further, you say. With the U.S. facing trillion-dollar deficits

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 12 (9752-10054) ---
urred the greatest economy that weï¿½ve ever seen just prior to COVID, and even after COVID. It was so strong that we were able to get through COVID much better than just about any other country. But we spurred ï¿½ that tax spurred.

Now, when we cut the taxes ï¿½ as an example, the corporate tax was

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 13 (10158-10610) ---
and companies were bringing back trillions of dollars back into our country.

The country was going like never before. And we were ready to start paying down debt. We were ready to start using the liquid gold right under our feet, the oil and gas right under our feet. We were going to have something that nobody else has had. We got hit with COVID. We did a lot to fix it. I gave him an unbelievable situation, with all of the therapeutics and all of

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 14 (10749-11120) ---
ad largely fixed it. More people died under his administration than our administration, and we were right in the middle of it. Something which a lot of people donï¿½t like to talk about, but he had far more people dying in his administration.

He did the mandate, which is a disaster. Mandating it. The vaccine went out. He did a mandate on the vaccine, which is the thin

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 15 (11332-11791) ---
ntry. They donï¿½t respect our leadership. They donï¿½t respect the United States anymore.

Weï¿½re like a Third World nation. Between weaponization of his election, trying to go after his political opponent, all of the things heï¿½s done, weï¿½ve become like a Third World nation. And itï¿½s a shame the damage heï¿½s done to our country.

And Iï¿½d love to ask him, and will, why he allowed millions of people to come in here from prisons, jails and mental

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 16 (12196-12807) ---
t Iï¿½m going to do is fix the taxes.

For example, we have a thousand trillionaires in America ï¿½ I mean, billionaires in America. And whatï¿½s happening? Theyï¿½re in a situation where they, in fact, pay 8.2 percent in taxes. If they just paid 24 percent or 25 percent, either one of those numbers, theyï¿½d raised $500 million ï¿½ billion dollars, I should say, in a 10-year period.

Weï¿½d be able to right ï¿½ wipe out his debt. Weï¿½d be able to help make sure that ï¿½ all those things we need to do, childcare, elder care, making sure that we continue to strengthen our healthcare system, making sure t

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 17 (12882-13304) ---
½ve been able to do with the COVID ï¿½ excuse me, with dealing with everything we have to do with.

Look, if ï¿½ we finally beat Medicare.

TAPPER:  Thank you, President Biden.

President Trump?

TRUMP:  Well, heï¿½s right: He did beat Medicaid (ph). He beat it to death. And heï¿½s destroying Medicare, because all of these people are coming in, theyï¿½re putting them on Medicare, theyï¿½re putting them on Social Securi

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 18 (13474-14099) ---
trying to put them on Social Security. He will wipe out Social Security. He will wipe out Medicare. So he was right in the way he finished that sentence, and itï¿½s a shame.

Whatï¿½s happened to our country in the last four years is not to be believed. Foreign countries ï¿½ Iï¿½m friends with a lot of people. They cannot believe what happened to the United States of America. Weï¿½re no longer respected. They donï¿½t like us. We give them everything they want, and they ï¿½ they think weï¿½re stupid. They think weï¿½re very stupid people.

What weï¿½re doing for other countries, and they do nothing for us. What this ma

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 19 (14871-15175) ---
rtion pill. And I agree with their decision to have done that, and I will not block it.

And if you look at this whole question that youï¿½re asking, a complex, but not really complex ï¿½ 51 years ago, you had Roe v. Wade, and everybody wanted to get it back to the states, everybody, without exception.

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 20 (15398-16382) ---
de and moving it back to the states. This is something that everybody wanted.

Now, 10 years ago or so, they started talking about how many weeks and how many of this ï¿½ getting into other things, But every legal scholar, throughout the world, the most respected, wanted it brought back to the states. I did that.

Now the states are working it out. If you look at Ohio, it was a decision that was ï¿½ that was an end result that was a little bit more liberal than you would have thought. Kansas I would say the same thing. Texas is different. Florida is different. But theyï¿½re all making their own decisions right now. And right now, the states control it. Thatï¿½s the vote of the people.

Like Ronald Reagan, I believe in the exceptions. I am a person that believes. And frankly, I think itï¿½s important to believe in the exceptions. Some people ï¿½ you have to follow your heart. Some people donï¿½t believe in that. But I believe in the exceptions for rape, incest and the li

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 21 (16651-16955) ---
life of a child in the eighth month, the ninth month, and even after birth ï¿½ after birth.

If you look at the former governor of Virginia, he was willing to do this. He said, weï¿½ll put the baby aside and weï¿½ll determine what we do with the baby. Meaning, weï¿½ll kill the baby.

What happened is we

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 22 (17596-18021) ---
our circumstances are, whether you need help.

The idea that states are able to do this is a little like saying, weï¿½re going to turn civil rights back to the states, let each state have a different rule.

Look, thereï¿½s so many young women who have been ï¿½ including a young woman who just was murdered and he went to the funeral. The idea that she was murdered by ï¿½ by ï¿½ by an immigrant coming in and (inaudible) tal

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 23 (18768-19315) ---
oncerned, it is now back with the states. The states are voting and in many cases, they ï¿½ itï¿½s, frankly, a very liberal decision. In many cases, itï¿½s the opposite.

But theyï¿½re voting and itï¿½s bringing it back to the vote of the people, which is what everybody wanted, including the founders, if they knew about this issue, which frankly they didnï¿½t, but they would have ï¿½ everybody want it brought back.

Ronald Reagan wanted it brought back. He wasnï¿½t able to get it.

Everybody wanted it brought back and many presidents had tri

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 24 (19905-20211) ---
r. Second time is between a doctor and an extreme situation. A third time is between the doctor ï¿½ I mean, itï¿½d be between the woman and the state.

The idea that the politicians ï¿½ that the founders wanted the politicians to be the ones making decisions about a womanï¿½s health is ridiculous. Thatï¿½

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 25 (20350-20905) ---
ï¿½s what youï¿½re going to do.

And if Iï¿½m elected, Iï¿½m going to restore Roe v. Wade.

TRUMP:  So that means he can take the life of the baby in the ninth month and even after birth, because some states, Democrat-run, take it after birth. Again, the governor ï¿½ former governor of Virginia:  put the baby down, then we decide what to do with it.

So heï¿½s in ï¿½ heï¿½s willing to, as we say, rip the baby out of the womb in the ninth month and kill the baby.

Nobody wants that to happen. Democrat or Republican, nobody wants it to happen.

BIDEN:

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 26 (21483-21788) ---
cans.

BIDEN:  For 51 years, that was the law. 51 years, constitutional scholarship said it was the right way to go. 51 years. And it was taken away because this guy put very conservative members on the Supreme Court. Takes credit for taking it away.

Whatï¿½s he going to do? Whatï¿½s he going to do, in

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 27 (22743-23336) ---
r police there are now. We significantly increased the number of asylum officers. Significantly ï¿½ by the way, the Border Patrol endorsed me, endorsed my position.

In addition to that, we found ourselves in a situation where, when he was president, he was taking ï¿½ separating babies from their mothers, putting them in cages, making sure the families were separated. Thatï¿½s not the right way to go.

What Iï¿½ve done ï¿½ since Iï¿½ve changed the law, whatï¿½s happened? Iï¿½ve changed it in a way that now youï¿½re in a situation where there are 40 percent fewer people coming across the

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 28 (23624-23928) ---
nï¿½t know what he said at the end of that sentence. I donï¿½t think he knows what he said either.

Look, we had the safest border in the history of our country. The border ï¿½ all he had to do was leave it. All he had to do was leave it.

He decided to open up our border, open up our country to people

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 29 (23985-24290) ---
utions, insane asylum, terrorists. We have the largest number of terrorists coming into our country right now. All terrorists, all over the world ï¿½ not just in South America, all over the world. They come from the Middle East, everywhere. All over the world, theyï¿½re pouring in. And this guy just left

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 30 (24441-24997) ---
final couple of months of my presidency, we had, according to Border Patrol ï¿½ who is great, and, by the way, who endorsed me for president. But I wonï¿½t say that. But they endorsed me for president.

Brandon, just speak to him.

But, look, we had the safest border in history. Now we have the worst border in history. Thereï¿½s never been anything like it. And people are dying all over the place, including the people that are coming up in caravans.

TAPPER:  Thank you, President Trump.

President Biden?

BIDEN:  The only terrorist who has done anyt

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 31 (25799-26101) ---
uding those whose spouses are citizens, and including those who have lived here for decades? And if so, how will you do it?

TRUMP:  Can I get one second?

He said we killed three people. The people we killed are al-Baghdadi and Salamani (sic), the two greatest terrorists, biggest terrorists anywhere

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 32 (26262-26567) ---
of thousands of people dying, and also killing our citizens when they come in. We ï¿½ we are living right now in a ratï¿½s nest. Theyï¿½re killing our people in New York, in California, in every state in the union, because we donï¿½t have borders anymore. Every state is now a border.

And because of his

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 33 (26760-27064) ---
Theyï¿½re killing our citizens at a level that weï¿½ve never seen before. And youï¿½re reading it like these three incredible young girls over the last few days. One of them, I just spoke to the mother, and we just had the funeral for this girl, 12 years old.

This is horrible whatï¿½s taken place. Wh

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 34 (27150-27828) ---
oesnï¿½t want it to be. He just doesnï¿½t know. He opened the borders nobodyï¿½s ever seen anything like. And we have to get a lot of these people out and we have to get them out fast, because theyï¿½re going to destroy our country.

Just take a look at where theyï¿½re living. Theyï¿½re living in luxury hotels in New York City and other places. Our veterans are on the street, theyï¿½re dying, because he doesnï¿½t care about our veterans. He doesnï¿½t care. He doesnï¿½t like the military at all. And he doesnï¿½t care about our veterans.

Nobodyï¿½s been worse. I had the highest approval rating for veterans, taking care of the V.A. He has the worst. Heï¿½s gotten rid of a

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 35 (28067-28369) ---
that we did ï¿½ and I think he did it just because I approved it, which is crazy. But he has killed so many people at our border by allowingï¿½

TAPPER:  Thank you, President Trump.

TRUMP:  ï¿½ all of these people to come in.

TAPPER:  President Bidenï¿½

TRUMP:  And itï¿½s a very sad day in America.

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 36 (29472-30743) ---
de-up quote, suckers and losers. They made it up. It was in a third-rate magazine thatï¿½s failing, like many of these magazines. He made that up. He put it in commercials. Weï¿½ve notified them. We had 19 people that said I didnï¿½t say it.

And think of this, who would say ï¿½ Iï¿½m at a cemetery, or Iï¿½m talking about our veterans ï¿½ because nobodyï¿½s taken better care ï¿½ Iï¿½m so glad this came up, and he brought it up. Thereï¿½s nobody thatï¿½s taken better care of our soldiers than I have.

To think that I would, in front of generals and others, say suckers and losers ï¿½ we have 19 people that said it was never said by me. It was made up by him, just like Russia, Russia, Russia was made up, just like the 51 intelligence agents are made up, just like the new thing with the 16 economists are talking.

Itï¿½s the same thing. Fifty-one intelligence agents said that the laptop was Russia disinformation. It wasnï¿½t. That came from his son Hunter. It wasnï¿½t Russia disinformation. He made up the suckers and losers, so he should apologize to me right now.

BIDEN:  You had a four-star general stand at your side, who was on your staff, who said you said it, period. Thatï¿½s number one.

And, number two, the idea ï¿½ the idea that I have to apologiz

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 37 (31114-31433) ---
V.A. is doing now. Theyï¿½re doing more for veterans than ever before in our history.

TAPPER:  All right. Thank you so much.

BASH:  Letï¿½s move to the topic of foreign policy. I want to begin with Russiaï¿½s war against Ukraine, which is now in its third year.

Former President Trump, Russian President Vladimir Put

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 38 (31740-33574) ---
t commander in chief, if thatï¿½s what you call him, that weï¿½ve ever had. They canï¿½t stand him. So letï¿½s get that straight.

And they like me more than just about any of them. And thatï¿½s based on every single bit of information.

As far as Russia and Ukraine, if we had a real president, a president that knew ï¿½ that was respected by Putin, he would have never ï¿½ he would have never invaded Ukraine.

A lot of people are dead right now, much more than people know. You know, they talk about numbers. You can double those numbers, maybe triple those numbers. He did nothing to stop it. In fact, I think he encouraged Russia from going in.

Iï¿½ll tell you what happened, he was so bad with Afghanistan, it was such a horrible embarrassment, most embarrassing moment in the history of our country, that when Putin watched that and he saw the incompetence that he should ï¿½ he should have fired those generals like I fired the one that you mentioned, and so heï¿½s got no love lost. But he should have fired those generals.

No general got fired for the most embarrassing moment in the history of our country, Afghanistan, where we left billions of dollars of equipment behind, we lost 13 beautiful soldiers and 38 soldiers were obliterated. And by the way, we left people behind too. We left American citizens behind.

When Putin saw that, he said, you know what? I think weï¿½re going to go in and maybe take my ï¿½ this was his dream. I talked to him about it, his dream. The difference is he never would have invaded Ukraine. Never.

Just like Israel would have never been invaded, in a million years, by Hamas. You know why? Because Iran was broke with me. I wouldnï¿½t let anybody do business with them. They ran out of money. They were broke. They had no money for Hamas. They had no money for anything. No money for

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 39 (33653-33993) ---
lace, the whole world is blowing up under him.

BASH:  President Biden?

BIDEN:  Iï¿½ve never heard so much malarkey in my whole life.

Look, the fact of the matter is that weï¿½re in a situation where ï¿½ letï¿½s take the last point first.  Iran attacked American troops, killed, caused brain damage for a number of these troops, and he di

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 40 (34252-34556) ---
hanistan during that airlift.

Number three, we found ourselves in a situation where, if you take a look at what Trump did in Ukraine, heï¿½s ï¿½ this guy told Ukraine ï¿½ told Trump, do whatever you want. Do whatever you want. And thatï¿½s exactly what Trump did to Putin, encouraged him, do whatever yo

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 41 (35179-35741) ---
the territory in Ukraine?

TRUMP:  No, theyï¿½re not acceptable. No, theyï¿½re not acceptable.

But look, this is a war that never should have started. If we had a leader in this war ï¿½ he led everybody along. Heï¿½s given $200 billion now or more to Ukraine. Heï¿½s given $200 billion. Thatï¿½s a lot of money. I donï¿½t think thereï¿½s ever been anything like it. Every time that Zelenskyy comes to this country, he walks away with $60 billion. Heï¿½s the greatest salesman ever.

And Iï¿½m not knocking him, Iï¿½m not knocking anything. Iï¿½m only saying, th

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 42 (35913-36230) ---
dent-elect before I take office on January 20th. Iï¿½ll have that war settled.

People being killed so needlessly, so stupidly, and I will get it settled and Iï¿½ll get it settled fast, before I take office.

BASH:  President Biden, you have a minute.

BIDEN:  The fact is that Putin is a war criminal. Heï¿½s killed

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 43 (36547-36992) ---
appens to Poland? What do you think of Belarus? What do you think happens to those NATO countries?

And so, if you want a war, you ought to find out what heï¿½s going to do. Because if, in fact, he does what he says and walks away ï¿½ by the way, all that money we give Ukraine and weapons we make here in the United States. We give them the weapons, not the money at this point. And our NATO allies have produced as much funding for Ukraine as

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 44 (37355-37769) ---
ian crisis in Gaza.

President Biden, youï¿½ve put forward a proposal to resolve this conflict. But so far, Hamas has not released the remaining hostages and Israel is continuing its military offensive in Gaza.

So what additional leverage will you use to get Hamas and Israel to end the war? You have two minutes.

BIDEN:  Number one, everyone from the United Nations Security Council straight through to the G7 t

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 45 (38284-39297) ---
ï¿½re finally ï¿½ the only thing Iï¿½ve denied Israel was 2,000-pound bombs. They donï¿½t work very well in populated areas. They kill a lot of innocent people. We are providing Israel with all the weapons they need and when they need them.

And by the way, Iï¿½m the guy that organized the world against Iran when they had a full-blown kind of ballistic ï¿½ ballistic missile attack on Israel. No one was hurt. No ï¿½ one Israeli was accidentally killed. And it stopped. We saved Israel.

We are the biggest producer of support for Israel than anyone in the world. And so, thatï¿½s ï¿½ thereï¿½re two different things.

Hamas cannot be allowed to be continued. We continue to send our experts and our intelligence people to how they can get Hamas like we did Bin Laden. You donï¿½t have to do it.

And by the way, theyï¿½ve been greatly weakened, Hamas, greatly weakened. And they should be. They should be eliminated.

But you got to be careful for what you use these certain weapons among population centers.

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 46 (39401-39737) ---
together have spent $100 billion, or maybe more than that, less than us. Why doesnï¿½t he call them so you got to put up your money like I did with NATO? I got them to put up hundreds of billions of dollars. The secretary general of NATO said Trump did the most incredible job Iï¿½ve ever seen. You wouldnï¿½t ï¿½ they wouldnï¿½t have a

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 47 (40251-40933) ---
one. And you should them go and let them finish the job.

He doesnï¿½t want to do it. Heï¿½s become like a Palestinian. But they donï¿½t like him, because heï¿½s a very bad Palestinian. Heï¿½s a weak one.

BASH:  President Biden, you have a minute.

BIDEN:  Iï¿½ve never heard so much foolishness.

This is a guy who wants to get out of NATO. Youï¿½re going to stay in NATO or youï¿½re going to pull out of NATO?

The idea that we have ï¿½ our strength lies in our alliances as well. It may be a big ocean, but weï¿½re ï¿½ (inaudible) able to avoid a war in Europe, a major war in Europe. What happens if, in fact, you have Putin continue to go into NATO? We have an Article Five ag

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 48 (41103-41571) ---
d and other places. See what happens then.

He has no idea what the hell heï¿½s talking about.

And by the way, I got 50 other nations around the world to support Ukraine, including Japan and South Korea, because they understand that this was ï¿½ this ï¿½ this kind of dislocation has a serious threat to the whole world peace. No ï¿½ no major war in Europe has ever been able to be contained just to Europe.

BASH:  President Trump, just to follow up, would you suppo

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 49 (41668-41970) ---
MP:  Iï¿½d have to see.

But before we do that, the problem we have is that we spend all the money. So they kill us on trade. I made great trade deals with the European nations, because if you add them up, theyï¿½re about the same size economically. Their economy is about the same size as the United S

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 50 (42256-42860) ---
es with NATO is because I got them to put up hundreds of billions of dollars. I said ï¿½ and heï¿½s right about this, I said, no, Iï¿½m not going to support NATO if you donï¿½t pay. They asked me that question: Would you guard us against Russia? ï¿½ at a very secret meeting of the 28 states at that time, nations at that time. And they (sic) said, no, if you donï¿½t pay, I wonï¿½t do that. And you know what happened? Billions and billions of dollars came flowing in the next day and the next months.

But now, weï¿½re in the same position. Weï¿½re paying everybodyï¿½s bills.

BASH:  Thank you.

TAPPE

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 51 (43281-43637) ---
oath through your actions and inaction on January 6th and worry that youï¿½ll do it again?

TRUMP:  Well, I donï¿½t think too many believe that.

And let me tell you about January 6th, on January 6th, we had a great border, nobody coming through, very few. On January 6th, we were energy independent. On January 6th, we had the lowest taxes ever, we had th

--- COMPRESSED SEGMENT 52 (43715-44019) ---
d.

All over the world we were respected, and then he comes in, and weï¿½re now laughed at, weï¿½re like a bunch of stupid people. What happened to the United Statesï¿½ reputation under this manï¿½s leadership is horrible, including weaponization, which Iï¿½m sure at some point youï¿½ll be talking about
